title: Is there any chance of proposing a different atomic structure? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, there is a chance but the probability of proposing a different atomic structure is very very small. If a better version of the prevailing atomic structure is proposed, then there is a chance of proposing a different atomic structure. The probability is less as the prevailing atomic structure satisfies most of the theories preposted by scientists, but nothing is impossible and even the prevailing atomic structure is drawn by assumptions and assumptions may be wrong. In future if anybody find a microscope which is capable of viewing atom there may be a big change in field of chemistry if the prevailing atomic structure differs from the original structure. Nothing is impossible and anything can happen in future so there is a chance for anything to happen in future.
